item.title: Release 1.113 Upgrade
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Securiti Upgrade to Release 1.113 Summary: Securiti will undergo an upgrade to Release 1.113, designed to not cause any disruption. Users are advised to visit the Knowledge Center for more information post-upgrade.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 4, 21:00 UTC  -  Apr 5, 01:00 UTC

Mar 6, 05:51 UTC
Scheduled - Securiti will be upgraded to Release 1.113. This is an in-service upgrade and is designed to not cause any disruption. Once the upgrade is complete, please log into the portal and navigate to Knowledge Center -> Release Notes for more information about the release content.

item.title: Release 1.112 Upgrade
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Securiti Upgrade to Release 1.112

Securiti will be upgraded to Release 1.112 with an in-service upgrade scheduled. Users are advised to log into the portal after the upgrade for more information. Summary: Scheduled upgrade to Release 1.112 with no expected disruption.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 21, 21:00 UTC  -  Mar 22, 01:00 UTC

Scheduled - Securiti will be upgraded to Release 1.112. This is an in-service upgrade and is designed to not cause any disruption. Once the upgrade is complete, please log into the portal and navigate to Knowledge Center -> Release Notes for more information about the release content.

item.title: Amendment to Securiti's Data Processing Agreement
item.content:encoded:
Feb 7, 01:20 UTC
Resolved - Dear Securiti Customer,

We are writing to let you know about the following updates to the Third-Party Sub-processors we engage for Securiti’s Data Command Center.

In addition to our existing sub-processors, we are utilizing the services of the following entity to enhance the functionality offered by the Data Command Center: Microsoft Azure.

We are using Microsoft Azure to assist in the natural language processing of users’ questions in Securiti Copilot. Customers have the option of disabling the Copilot feature, or not using it, in which case Microsoft Azure will not serve as a sub-processor for that customer.

No action is required on your part.

You can find information about our sub-processors in the Schedule 2 section at this link: https://securiti.ai/terms/#data-processing-agreement-addendum

Thank you for choosing Securiti.

item.title: Degraded performance
item.content:encoded:
Sep 19, 05:09 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Sep 19, 03:43 UTC
Monitoring - As per AWS, the situation has improved but the incident hasn't yet been marked as resolved. Securiti team is continuing to monitor.

Sep 18, 23:32 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor the updates from AWS with respect to this incident. AWS is expecting the issue to be completely resolved in the next 60 to 90 minutes.

Sep 18, 19:44 UTC
Identified - Some AWS services are currently experiencing network related performance issues. As a result, some functions of the Securiti platform are affected.

item.title: Consent Database Maintenance
item.content:encoded:
Apr 4, 04:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Apr 4, 01:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 31, 19:04 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing routine maintenance on consent database for some performance improvements. During this maintenance window, consent recording will be paused (and held in a queue). Once the maintenance is completed, the consent recording will be resumed and dashboards will reflect the data. No data loss will occur.
